arts.ttl: Yamal scores from penalty spot but Barcelona needs goalkeeper Joan García to leave Rayo with a point
arts.sum: Lamine Yamal scored from the penalty spot but Barcelona needed goalkeeper Joan García to ensure it left Rayo Vallecano with a point after a 1-1 draw in the Spanish league on Sunday. Yamal got the penalty after he dribbled past a defender and was knocked down by Pep Chavarría in a foul that was fiercely protested by Rayo’s players and staff.

arts.ttl: Takeaways From Barcelona’s Worrying Performance in 1-1 Draw vs. Rayo Vallecano
arts.sum: Barcelona looked miles off the level they showed a season ago.

arts.ttl: Rayo draw with Barça after contested Yamal pen
arts.sum: Lamine Yamal scored from the penalty spot but Barcelona needed goalkeeper Joan García to ensure they left Rayo Vallecano with a point after a 1-1 draw in the Spanish league on Sunday.

arts.ttl: VAR nowhere to be seen as champions Barca are held by Rayo in La Liga
arts.sum: There was VAR drama as Barcelona dropped two valuable points in La Liga on Sunday night, with the reining champions held by an impressive Rayo Vallecano outfit.

arts.ttl: Barcelona Player Ratings vs. Rayo Vallecano: Joan Garcia Rescues a Point in 1–1 Draw
arts.sum: Barcelona were dominated by Rayo Vallecano in the second half and lucky to escape with a draw.

arts.ttl: Joan Garcia 10, Pedri 9.0 | Rayo Vallecano 1-1 Barcelona: Player ratings
arts.sum: A challenging encounter at Vallecas ends in a draw for Barcelona and Rayo Vallecano. Ultimately, both teams leave the game with one point each. However, this could have been much more ugly for Barça. Apart from a penalty converted and won by Lamine Yamal, La Blaugrana failed to find the back of the net. arts.ttl: ‘Maradona played in the mud’ – Rayo chief fires message to Barcelona ahead of La Liga clash

arts.sum: FC Barcelona have officially announced their starting eleven that will take on Rayo Vallecano this evening as the club look to extend their winning run to three games in La Liga.
